title: Sarah Azhari
author: Sarah Azhari
created_time: July 17, 2022, 12:40:10 AMLast edit: July 17, 2022, 01:34:51 AM by Sarah Azhari
content: this thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5406562.0 on the service board almost covers another thread and is very annoying. i think it was today is April fools after look that.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: I think the author of the post was intentionally trying to scream for attention. He used this character in his post title "    "I doubt if there's much the moderators can do except maybe delete the post

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.created_time: July 17, 2022, 12:52:27 AMLast edit: July 17, 2022, 01:04:08 AM by PX-Z
comments.body: How is it annoying? And how it connects to forum April fools day?As if you just saw that tilde key/icon here or on your keyboardEdit: I see the look a like letter U, although it's just a normal capital U in mobile browser...I dont think theymos will disable the using of such unicode/symbol(or whatever you call it) on title thread on its to do list but its possible.

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: LOL, annoying or interesting or nothing, it depends on you.I don't see any kind of thing with the symbol so I would prefer to let it be. {()} (.) 0U0 is it annoying? I don't see why anyone consider it is annoying.

comments.author: Text
comments.body: I didn't find it annoying on my end because it fits where it should be.  You thought it was a virus?  Maybe with just your browser, what are you using?I'm using Chrome android mobile browser.

comments.author: Sarah Azhari
comments.body: I used chrome with 1366×768 resolution. If any post after that thread, it will definitely cover the title thread above.

comments.author: indah rezqi
comments.body: Quote from: Sarah Azhari on July 17, 2022, 01:32:12 AMI used chrome with 1366×768 resolution. If any post after that thread, it will definitely cover the title thread above.Imo, it's depends on the browser you are using, I can say it will be displayed without being annoying if you are using TOR. I'd also say it's annoying if I use crhome, but maybe not if I use mozilla or TOR browsers.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: I checked on several browsers, and nothing like what you write happens. Most likely, you have a problem.These are just symbols. If the moderator will be distracted by the complaint of each participant from the fact that they are not satisfied with the symbols, and at the same time they are different, I do not think that this will be useful.As an example, write to the creator of the branch and explain that this is very annoying for you, and ask to change the symbol.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on July 17, 2022, 02:31:04 AMI checked on several browsers, and nothing like what you write happens. Most likely, you have a problem.These are just symbols. If the moderator will be distracted by the complaint of each participant from the fact that they are not satisfied with the symbols, and at the same time they are different, I do not think that this will be useful.As an example, write to the creator of the branch and explain that this is very annoying for you, and ask to change the symbol. I looked at a few browsers and was able to see it when using Microsoft Edge.  It is pretty annoying on that browser, I will admit.  I've never seen anything like this before on the forum, but I'm typically using Safari or Firefox.  I don't think the OP has a problem (other than using Microsoft Edge for a browser) and it seems like this is normal.  Can anyone else confirm they see this using Microsoft Edge?  I'd hate to think that I also have a problem.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on July 17, 2022, 02:39:45 AMCan anyone else confirm they see this using Microsoft Edge?  I'd hate to think that I also have a problem.  Same with me.I have tried switching the hardware acceleration mode on and off and changing the font style in the appearance settings of the MS Edge browser, but to no avail; the issue still exists. I'm just unsure if this issue is related to their previous problems with distorted text and images, where rendering issues are a thing[1], which I certainly do not.[1] https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftedge/forum/all/microsoft-edge-distorted-characters-in-webpage/44be0eed-8a17-40d3-9ecd-cbf0692b2c11

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: SquirrelJulietGarden on July 17, 2022, 01:10:13 AM{()} (.) 0U0 is it annoying? I don't see why anyone consider it is annoying.Looks like a gonorrhea-infected vagina, whaddya want?  Everyone's got their own taste, and I looked at that thread and didn't see anything that evoked strong feelings in me one way or another.  Besides, it's a thread that's probably going to die a quick death unless the OP keeps bumping it.Quote from: PX-Z on July 17, 2022, 12:52:27 AMHow is it annoying? And how it connects to forum April fools day?Man, I'm totally at a loss to explain why OP feels the way he does about that symbol.  Maybe it's a personal psychological thing.

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: Quote from: The Pharmacist on July 17, 2022, 04:26:00 AMQuote from: SquirrelJulietGarden on July 17, 2022, 01:10:13 AM{()} (.) 0U0 is it annoying? I don't see why anyone consider it is annoying.Looks like a gonorrhea-infected vagina, whaddya want?  Everyone's got their own taste, and I looked at that thread and didn't see anything that evoked strong feelings in me one way or another.  Besides, it's a thread that's probably going to die a quick death unless the OP keeps bumping it.Joking only.I implied that it depends on each user view. If we simply view it as it is, nothing is bad and annoying. It is only random thing. Combine of random things can not make annoying things.{($()&~ is random combination and not annoying but why {()} or 0U0 is annoying. I don't be creative with this combination. I saw it on forum and I did not feel bad. Icon or word, it is not annoying if we don't use it with bad intention.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: It looks okay in my browser, without overlapping other lines.That being said, I don't think the topic belongs on the Services board. "Join Telegram" is just spam. Reported.

comments.body: it was overlapping the titleThis bug happens in the SMF forum only I think, where only certain browsers on laptops, chrome, brave, and edge. ( I used an IBM ThinkPad). when checked on my phone the symbol doesn't look like the same in the laptop.

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: crwth on July 17, 2022, 07:14:31 AMIt's kind of annoying as well. It shows like that to me too. ~Snip~~Snip~I'm using Windows 11 though, are you using it too? And I'm using Brave.I am using windows 10 and browsing with Chrome, and it looks just the same way.Indeed, that signs looks very annoying as it even extended over to the post heading the is above it.But i agree with what the other user said, the author of this is just using it as an attention grabber which to me, is absolutely a wrong choice, there are other better ways and symbols one can use as an attention grabber rather than this annoying signs, i hope the moderators take action on the post.

comments.author: rozak
comments.body: I initially opened this thread via a browser on my mobile device, but nothing strange happened. but when I see it again on PC chrome web, it does look annoying. as the OP described.this looks similar to the case of some code signatures which look messy when viewed from a mobile browser. but it looks neat when viewed from a PC browser.

comments.author: Falconer
comments.body: No problem here (Crhome mobile version) but might be a bit messy on PC especially if using chrome. The ignore user option can help you hide such thread and OP, otherwise please report the thread to a moderator and give a little reason why it should be addressed but I doubt the right course of action for the thread.Quote from: Sarah Azhari on July 17, 2022, 12:40:10 AMi think it was today is April fools after look that.Well that reminds me of a virus infection some time ago on the forum during April Fools' Day. But now I don't think it has anything to do with it, it's just a unique code.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.created_time: July 17, 2022, 03:26:38 PMLast edit: July 17, 2022, 05:03:07 PM by Findingnemo
comments.body: The thread mentioned in the OP doesn't actually belongs to the service section in my opinion and it looks like an obvious scam so trying my luck here for deleting the thread with report to moderator button and let's see what happens.And about the symbol yes its actually annoying as hell, but moderator has nothing to do with the title and symbol so it has to come from admin and probably in the next few hours the thread will be trashed and for others don't feed the trolls and scams.EDIT: The thread is already deleted by mod now.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on July 17, 2022, 10:50:29 AMi hope the moderators take action on the post.Looks like the mod has already taken action, the thread was removed from the service board and archived here: https://ninjastic.space/topic/5406562I agree that the creator of the topic seems to want to draw a lot of attention to his thread by using symbols or codes like that. So it's actually really annoying because it's overlapping, but it's good that it's been removed now. So, the OP can now lock this thread as the question was already resolved by the mod by deleting the topic. Next time just report a thread like that instead of making a thread like this because I'm sure the mod will take action if it's annoying. Besides, you should also change the title of this thread because the code or symbols you use are just as annoying.
